alert.note: Alert for East Cameron; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; Upper Vermilion; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 2:27AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cameron, Jefferson Davis, Acadia, southeastern Calcasieu and northwestern Vermilion Parishes through 300 AM CDT... At 227 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Basile to Welsh to near Holmwood to near Holly Beach. Movement was southeast at 90 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crowley, Eunice, Jennings, Cameron, Welsh, Lake Arthur, Iota, Gueydan, Mermentau, Hayes, Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, Grand Chenier, Klondike, Evangeline, Morse, Mowata, Hacketts Corner, Maxie, Egan and Holly Beach. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 51 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for central and southwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Cameron; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; Upper Vermilion; West Cameron
